fields.description: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

fields.name: chat_member
fields.description: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat_member” in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

fields.name: chat_join_request
fields.description: Optional. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

types.name: WebhookInfo
types.description: Describes the current status of a webhook.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

fields.name: has_custom_certificate
fields.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

fields.name: pending_update_count
fields.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

fields.name: ip_address
fields.description: Optional. Currently used webhook IP address

fields.name: last_error_date
fields.description: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

fields.name: last_error_message
fields.description: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

fields.name: last_synchronization_error_date
fields.description: Optional. Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters

fields.name: max_connections
fields.description: Optional. The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

fields.name: allowed_updates
fields.description: Optional. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except chat_member

types.name: User
types.description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: is_bot
fields.description: True, if this user is a bot

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: User's or bot's first name

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. User's or bot's last name

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. User's or bot's username

fields.name: language_code
fields.description: Optional. IETF language tag of the user's language

fields.name: is_premium
fields.description: Optional. True, if this user is a Telegram Premium user

fields.name: added_to_attachment_menu
fields.description: Optional. True, if this user added the bot to the attachment menu

fields.name: can_join_groups
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in getMe.

fields.name: can_read_all_group_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if privacy mode is disabled for the bot. Returned only in getMe.

fields.name: supports_inline_queries
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in getMe.

types.name: Chat
types.description: This object represents a chat.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

fields.name: username
fields.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

fields.name: is_forum
fields.description: Optional. True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has topics enabled)

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Chat photo. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: active_usernames
fields.description: Optional. If non-empty, the list of all active chat usernames; for private chats, supergroups and channels. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: emoji_status_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of emoji status of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: emoji_status_expiration_date
fields.description: Optional. Expiration date of the emoji status of the other party in a private chat, if any. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: bio
fields.description: Optional. Bio of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: has_private_forwards
fields.description: Optional. True, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use tg://user?id=<user_id> links only in chats with the user. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: has_restricted_voice_and_video_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the privacy settings of the other party restrict sending voice and video note messages in the private chat. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: join_to_send_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: join_by_request
fields.description: Optional. True, if all users directly joining the supergroup need to be approved by supergroup administrators. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: Optional. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: pinned_message
fields.description: Optional. The most recent pinned message (by sending date). Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description: Optional. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: slow_mode_delay
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unpriviledged user; in seconds. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: message_auto_delete_time
fields.description: Optional. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled
fields.description: Optional. True, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The field is only available to chat administrators. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: has_hidden_members
fields.description: Optional. True, if non-administrators can only get the list of bots and administrators in the chat. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: has_protected_content
fields.description: Optional. True, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: sticker_set_name
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, name of group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: can_set_sticker_set
fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: linked_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. Returned only in getChat.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected. Returned only in getChat.

types.name: Message
types.description: This object represents a message.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only

fields.name: from
fields.description: Optional. Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

fields.name: sender_chat
fields.description: Optional. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group. For backward compatibility, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Conversation the message belongs to

fields.name: forward_from
fields.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

fields.name: forward_from_chat
fields.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels or from anonymous administrators, information about the original sender chat

fields.name: forward_from_message_id
fields.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, identifier of the original message in the channel

fields.name: forward_signature
fields.description: Optional. For forwarded messages that were originally sent in channels or by an anonymous chat administrator, signature of the message sender if present

fields.name: forward_sender_name
fields.description: Optional. Sender's name for messages forwarded from users who disallow adding a link to their account in forwarded messages

fields.name: forward_date
fields.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

fields.name: is_topic_message
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message is sent to a forum topic

fields.name: is_automatic_forward
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group

fields.name: reply_to_message
fields.description: Optional. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

fields.name: via_bot
fields.description: Optional. Bot through which the message was sent

fields.name: edit_date
fields.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

fields.name: has_protected_content
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message can't be forwarded

fields.name: media_group_id
fields.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

fields.name: author_signature
fields.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

fields.name: text
fields.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message

fields.name: entities
fields.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

fields.name: animation
fields.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

fields.name: audio
fields.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

fields.name: document
fields.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

fields.name: photo
fields.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

fields.name: story
fields.description: Optional. Message is a forwarded story

fields.name: video
fields.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

fields.name: video_note
fields.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message

fields.name: voice
fields.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, photo, video or voice

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

fields.name: has_media_spoiler
fields.description: Optional. True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

fields.name: contact
fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

fields.name: dice
fields.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value

fields.name: game
fields.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games »

fields.name: poll
fields.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

fields.name: venue
fields.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

fields.name: new_chat_members
fields.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

fields.name: left_chat_member
fields.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

fields.name: new_chat_title
fields.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value

fields.name: new_chat_photo
fields.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value

fields.name: delete_chat_photo
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

fields.name: group_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created

fields.name: supergroup_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

fields.name: channel_chat_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

fields.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
fields.description: Optional. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

fields.name: migrate_to_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: migrate_from_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: pinned_message
fields.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it is itself a reply.

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments »

fields.name: successful_payment
fields.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. More about payments »

fields.name: user_shared
fields.description: Optional. Service message: a user was shared with the bot

fields.name: chat_shared
fields.description: Optional. Service message: a chat was shared with the bot

fields.name: connected_website
fields.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. More about Telegram Login »

fields.name: write_access_allowed
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the user allowed the bot added to the attachment menu to write messages

fields.name: passport_data
fields.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data

fields.name: proximity_alert_triggered
fields.description: Optional. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

fields.name: forum_topic_created
fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic created

fields.name: forum_topic_edited
fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic edited

fields.name: forum_topic_closed
fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic closed

fields.name: forum_topic_reopened
fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic reopened

fields.name: general_forum_topic_hidden
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic hidden

fields.name: general_forum_topic_unhidden
fields.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic unhidden

fields.name: video_chat_scheduled
fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat scheduled

fields.name: video_chat_started
fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat started

fields.name: video_chat_ended
fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat ended

fields.name: video_chat_participants_invited
fields.description: Optional. Service message: new participants invited to a video chat

fields.name: web_app_data
fields.description: Optional. Service message: data sent by a Web App

fields.name: reply_markup
fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message. login_url buttons are represented as ordinary url buttons.

types.name: MessageId
types.description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Unique message identifier

types.name: MessageEntity
types.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be “mention” (@username), “hashtag” (#hashtag), “cashtag” ($USD), “bot_command” (/start@jobs_bot), “url” (https://telegram.org), “email” (do-not-reply@telegram.org), “phone_number” (+1-212-555-0123), “bold” (bold text), “italic” (italic text), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “spoiler” (spoiler message), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text_mention” (for users without usernames), “custom_emoji” (for inline custom emoji stickers)

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity

fields.name: length
fields.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. For “text_link” only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text

fields.name: user
fields.description: Optional. For “text_mention” only, the mentioned user

fields.name: language
fields.description: Optional. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text

fields.name: custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. For “custom_emoji” only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use getCustomEmojiStickers to get full information about the sticker

types.name: PhotoSize
types.description: This object represents one size of a photo or a file / sticker thumbnail.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Photo width

fields.name: height
fields.description: Photo height

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes

types.name: Animation
types.description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Video width as defined by sender

fields.name: height
fields.description: Video height as defined by sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Animation thumbnail as defined by sender

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original animation filename as defined by sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

types.name: Audio
types.description: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: performer
fields.description: Optional. Performer of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional. Title of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

types.name: Document
types.description: This object represents a general file (as opposed to photos, voice messages and audio files).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Document thumbnail as defined by sender

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

types.name: Story
types.description: This object represents a message about a forwarded story in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: Video
types.description: This object represents a video file.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: width
fields.description: Video width as defined by sender

fields.name: height
fields.description: Video height as defined by sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

fields.name: file_name
fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

types.name: VideoNote
types.description: This object represents a video message (available in Telegram apps as of v.4.0).

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: length
fields.description: Video width and height (diameter of the video message) as defined by sender

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes

types.name: Voice
types.description: This object represents a voice note.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

types.name: Contact
types.description: This object represents a phone contact.

fields.name: phone_number
fields.description: Contact's phone number

fields.name: first_name
fields.description: Contact's first name

fields.name: last_name
fields.description: Optional. Contact's last name

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Optional. Contact's user identifier in Telegram. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: vcard
fields.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard

types.name: Dice
types.description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

fields.name: emoji
fields.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for “”, “” and “” base emoji, 1-5 for “” and “” base emoji, 1-64 for “” base emoji

types.name: PollOption
types.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

fields.name: voter_count
fields.description: Number of users that voted for this option

types.name: PollAnswer
types.description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

fields.name: poll_id
fields.description: Unique poll identifier

fields.name: voter_chat
fields.description: Optional. The chat that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter is anonymous

fields.name: user
fields.description: Optional. The user that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter isn't anonymous

fields.name: option_ids
fields.description: 0-based identifiers of chosen answer options. May be empty if the vote was retracted.

types.name: Poll
types.description: This object contains information about a poll.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique poll identifier

fields.name: question
fields.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

fields.name: options
fields.description: List of poll options

fields.name: total_voter_count
fields.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

fields.name: is_closed
fields.description: True, if the poll is closed

fields.name: is_anonymous
fields.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

fields.name: type
fields.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

fields.name: allows_multiple_answers
fields.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

fields.name: correct_option_id
fields.description: Optional. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

fields.name: explanation
fields.description: Optional. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

fields.name: explanation_entities
fields.description: Optional. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

fields.name: open_period
fields.description: Optional. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

fields.name: close_date
fields.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

types.name: Location
types.description: This object represents a point on the map.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude as defined by sender

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude as defined by sender

fields.name: horizontal_accuracy
fields.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

fields.name: live_period
fields.description: Optional. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

fields.name: heading
fields.description: Optional. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

fields.name: proximity_alert_radius
fields.description: Optional. The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

types.name: Venue
types.description: This object represents a venue.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

fields.name: title
fields.description: Name of the venue

fields.name: address
fields.description: Address of the venue

fields.name: foursquare_id
fields.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue

fields.name: foursquare_type
fields.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

fields.name: google_place_id
fields.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

fields.name: google_place_type
fields.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

types.name: WebAppData
types.description: Describes data sent from a Web App to the bot.

fields.name: data
fields.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

fields.name: button_text
fields.description: Text of the web_app keyboard button from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

types.name: ProximityAlertTriggered
types.description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

fields.name: traveler
fields.description: User that triggered the alert

fields.name: watcher
fields.description: User that set the alert

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The distance between the users

types.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
types.description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

fields.name: message_auto_delete_time
fields.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

types.name: ForumTopicCreated
types.description: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the topic

fields.name: icon_color
fields.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

types.name: ForumTopicClosed
types.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: ForumTopicEdited
types.description: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Optional. New name of the topic, if it was edited

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed

types.name: ForumTopicReopened
types.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: GeneralForumTopicHidden
types.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: GeneralForumTopicUnhidden
types.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: UserShared
types.description: This object contains information about the user whose identifier was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUser button.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Identifier of the request

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Identifier of the shared user. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the user and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the user is already known to the bot by some other means.

types.name: ChatShared
types.description: This object contains information about the chat whose identifier was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestChat button.

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Identifier of the request

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.

types.name: WriteAccessAllowed
types.description: This object represents a service message about a user allowing a bot to write messages after adding the bot to the attachment menu or launching a Web App from a link.

fields.name: web_app_name
fields.description: Optional. Name of the Web App which was launched from a link

types.name: VideoChatScheduled
types.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

types.name: VideoChatStarted
types.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

types.name: VideoChatEnded
types.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Video chat duration in seconds

types.name: VideoChatParticipantsInvited
types.description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

fields.name: users
fields.description: New members that were invited to the video chat

types.name: UserProfilePhotos
types.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

fields.name: total_count
fields.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

fields.name: photos
fields.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

types.name: File
types.description: This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: file_size
fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

fields.name: file_path
fields.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

types.name: WebAppInfo
types.description: Describes a Web App.

fields.name: url
fields.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in Initializing Web Apps

types.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
types.description: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples).

fields.name: keyboard
fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects

fields.name: is_persistent
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.

fields.name: resize_keyboard
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

fields.name: one_time_keyboard
fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

fields.name: input_field_placeholder
fields.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

fields.name: selective
fields.description:
Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

types.name: KeyboardButton
types.description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. For simple text buttons, String can be used instead of this object to specify the button text. The optional fields web_app, request_user, request_chat, request_contact, request_location, and request_poll are mutually exclusive.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

fields.name: request_user
fields.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Tapping on any user will send their identifier to the bot in a “user_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_chat
fields.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a “chat_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_contact
fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_location
fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: request_poll
fields.description: Optional. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Optional. If specified, the described Web App will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web_app_data” service message. Available in private chats only.

types.name: KeyboardButtonRequestUser
types.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable user. The identifier of the selected user will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. More about requesting users »

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the UserShared object. Must be unique within the message

fields.name: user_is_bot
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a bot, pass False to request a regular user. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: user_is_premium
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a premium user, pass False to request a non-premium user. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

types.name: KeyboardButtonRequestChat
types.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. The identifier of the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. More about requesting chats »

fields.name: request_id
fields.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the ChatShared object. Must be unique within the message

fields.name: chat_is_channel
fields.description: Pass True to request a channel chat, pass False to request a group or a supergroup chat.

fields.name: chat_is_forum
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a forum supergroup, pass False to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: chat_has_username
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass False to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: chat_is_created
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: user_administrator_rights
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of bot_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: bot_administrator_rights
fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of user_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

fields.name: bot_is_member
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

types.name: KeyboardButtonPollType
types.description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Optional. If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

types.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
types.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup).

fields.name: remove_keyboard
fields.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)

fields.name: selective
fields.description:
Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

types.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
types.description: This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

fields.name: inline_keyboard
fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects

types.name: InlineKeyboardButton
types.description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Label text on the button

fields.name: url
fields.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their ID without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

fields.name: callback_data
fields.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Available only in private chats between a user and the bot.

fields.name: login_url
fields.description: Optional. An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the Telegram Login Widget.

fields.name: switch_inline_query
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted.

fields.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
fields.description:
Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.

This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options.

fields.name: switch_inline_query_chosen_chat
fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats of the specified type, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field

fields.name: callback_game
fields.description:
Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.

NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

fields.name: pay
fields.description:
Optional. Specify True, to send a Pay button.

NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

types.name: LoginUrl
types.description: This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the Telegram Login Widget when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:

fields.name: url
fields.description:
An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.

NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

fields.name: forward_text
fields.description: Optional. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

fields.name: bot_username
fields.description: Optional. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

fields.name: request_write_access
fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

types.name: SwitchInlineQueryChosenChat
types.description: This object represents an inline button that switches the current user to inline mode in a chosen chat, with an optional default inline query.

fields.name: query
fields.description: Optional. The default inline query to be inserted in the input field. If left empty, only the bot's username will be inserted

fields.name: allow_user_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if private chats with users can be chosen

fields.name: allow_bot_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if private chats with bots can be chosen

fields.name: allow_group_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if group and supergroup chats can be chosen

fields.name: allow_channel_chats
fields.description: Optional. True, if channel chats can be chosen

types.name: CallbackQuery
types.description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this query

fields.name: from
fields.description: Sender

fields.name: message
fields.description: Optional. Message with the callback button that originated the query. Note that message content and message date will not be available if the message is too old

fields.name: inline_message_id
fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

fields.name: chat_instance
fields.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.

fields.name: game_short_name
fields.description: Optional. Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

types.name: ForceReply
types.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode.

fields.name: force_reply
fields.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

fields.name: input_field_placeholder
fields.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

fields.name: selective
fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

types.name: ChatPhoto
types.description: This object represents a chat photo.

fields.name: small_file_id
fields.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

fields.name: small_file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: big_file_id
fields.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

fields.name: big_file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

types.name: ChatInviteLink
types.description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: Creator of the link

fields.name: creates_join_request
fields.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators

fields.name: is_primary
fields.description: True, if the link is primary

fields.name: is_revoked
fields.description: True, if the link is revoked

fields.name: name
fields.description: Optional. Invite link name

fields.name: expire_date
fields.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

fields.name: member_limit
fields.description: Optional. The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

fields.name: pending_join_request_count
fields.description: Optional. Number of pending join requests created using this link

types.name: ChatAdministratorRights
types.description: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

fields.name: is_anonymous
fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

fields.name: can_manage_chat
fields.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

fields.name: can_delete_messages
fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

fields.name: can_manage_video_chats
fields.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

fields.name: can_restrict_members
fields.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

fields.name: can_promote_members
fields.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_post_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

fields.name: can_edit_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

fields.name: can_pin_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

fields.name: can_manage_topics
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; supergroups only

types.name: ChatMemberOwner
types.description: Represents a chat member that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “creator”

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: is_anonymous
fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

fields.name: custom_title
fields.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

types.name: ChatMemberAdministrator

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “administrator”

fields.name: can_be_edited

fields.name: is_anonymous
fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

fields.name: can_manage_chat
fields.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

fields.name: can_delete_messages
fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

fields.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

fields.name: can_restrict_members

fields.name: can_promote_members
fields.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_post_messages

fields.name: can_edit_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

fields.name: can_pin_messages

fields.name: can_manage_topics
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; supergroups only

fields.name: custom_title

types.name: ChatMemberMember
types.description: Represents a chat member that has no additional privileges or restrictions.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “member”

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

types.name: ChatMemberRestricted
types.description: Represents a chat member that is under certain restrictions in the chat. Supergroups only.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “restricted”

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: is_member
fields.description: True, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

fields.name: can_send_messages
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, invoices, locations and venues

fields.name: can_send_audios
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send audios

fields.name: can_send_documents
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send documents

fields.name: can_send_photos
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send photos

fields.name: can_send_videos
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send videos

fields.name: can_send_video_notes
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

fields.name: can_send_voice_notes
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

fields.name: can_send_polls
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send polls

fields.name: can_send_other_messages
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

fields.name: can_add_web_page_previews

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_pin_messages
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to pin messages

fields.name: can_manage_topics
fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics

fields.name: until_date
fields.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time. If 0, then the user is restricted forever

types.name: ChatMemberLeft
types.description: Represents a chat member that isn't currently a member of the chat, but may join it themselves.

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “left”

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

types.name: ChatMemberBanned
types.description: Represents a chat member that was banned in the chat and can't return to the chat or view chat messages.

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “kicked”

fields.name: user
fields.description: Information about the user

fields.name: until_date
fields.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time. If 0, then the user is banned forever

types.name: ChatMemberUpdated
types.description: This object represents changes in the status of a chat member.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat the user belongs to

fields.name: from
fields.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

fields.name: old_chat_member
fields.description: Previous information about the chat member

fields.name: new_chat_member
fields.description: New information about the chat member

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: Optional. Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

fields.name: via_chat_folder_invite_link
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user joined the chat via a chat folder invite link

types.name: ChatJoinRequest
types.description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

fields.name: chat
fields.description: Chat to which the request was sent

fields.name: from
fields.description: User that sent the join request

fields.name: user_chat_id
fields.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 24 hours to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.

fields.name: date
fields.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time

fields.name: bio
fields.description: Optional. Bio of the user.

fields.name: invite_link
fields.description: Optional. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request

types.name: ChatPermissions
types.description: Describes actions that a non-administrator user is allowed to take in a chat.

fields.name: can_send_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, invoices, locations and venues

fields.name: can_send_audios
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send audios

fields.name: can_send_documents
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send documents

fields.name: can_send_photos
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send photos

fields.name: can_send_videos
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send videos

fields.name: can_send_video_notes
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

fields.name: can_send_voice_notes
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

fields.name: can_send_polls
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send polls

fields.name: can_send_other_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

fields.name: can_add_web_page_previews
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

fields.name: can_change_info
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings. Ignored in public supergroups

fields.name: can_invite_users
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.name: can_pin_messages
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages. Ignored in public supergroups

fields.name: can_manage_topics
fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics. If omitted defaults to the value of can_pin_messages

types.name: ChatLocation
types.description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected.

fields.name: location
fields.description: The location to which the supergroup is connected. Can't be a live location.

fields.name: address
fields.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

types.name: ForumTopic
types.description: This object represents a forum topic.

fields.name: message_thread_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the forum topic

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the topic

fields.name: icon_color
fields.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

types.name: BotCommand
types.description: This object represents a bot command.

fields.name: command
fields.description: Text of the command; 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the command; 1-256 characters.

types.name: BotCommandScopeDefault
types.description: Represents the default scope of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a narrower scope are specified for the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be default

types.name: BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
types.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all private chats.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats

types.name: BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
types.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats

types.name: BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
types.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators

types.name: BotCommandScopeChat
types.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be chat

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

types.name: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
types.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all administrators of a specific group or supergroup chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

types.name: BotCommandScopeChatMember
types.description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific member of a group or supergroup chat.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Scope type, must be chat_member

fields.name: chat_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user

types.name: BotName
types.description: This object represents the bot's name.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The bot's name

types.name: BotDescription
types.description: This object represents the bot's description.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The bot's description

types.name: BotShortDescription
types.description: This object represents the bot's short description.

fields.name: short_description
fields.description: The bot's short description

types.name: MenuButtonCommands
types.description: Represents a menu button, which opens the bot's list of commands.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the button, must be commands

types.name: MenuButtonWebApp
types.description: Represents a menu button, which launches a Web App.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the button, must be web_app

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text on the button

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery.

types.name: MenuButtonDefault
types.description: Describes that no specific value for the menu button was set.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the button, must be default

types.name: ResponseParameters
types.description: Describes why a request was unsuccessful.

fields.name: migrate_to_chat_id
fields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

fields.name: retry_after
fields.description: Optional. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

types.name: InputMediaPhoto
types.description: Represents a photo to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be photo

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »

fields.name: caption
fields.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

fields.name: parse_mode
fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

fields.name: caption_entities
fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

fields.name: has_spoiler
fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the photo needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

types.name: InputMediaVideo
types.description: Represents a video to be sent.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the result, must be video

fields.name: media
fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »

fields.name: thumbnail
fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. types.name: Sticker
types.description: This object represents a sticker.

fields.name: file_id
fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

fields.name: file_unique_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

fields.name: set_name

types.name: MaskPosition
types.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

fields.name: point
fields.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

fields.name: x_shift
fields.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

fields.name: y_shift
fields.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

types.name: InputSticker
types.description: This object describes a sticker to be added to a sticker set.

fields.name: sticker
fields.description: The added sticker. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, upload a new one using multipart/form-data, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. Animated and video stickers can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. More information on Sending Files »

fields.name: emoji_list
fields.description: List of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

fields.name: mask_position
fields.description: Optional. Position where the mask should be placed on faces. For “mask” stickers only.

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: Optional. List of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters. For “regular” and “custom_emoji” stickers only.

types.name: InlineQuery
types.description: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this query

fields.name: from
fields.description: Sender

fields.name: query
fields.description: Text of the query (up to 256 characters)

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot

fields.name: chat_type
fields.description: Optional. Type of the chat from which the inline query was sent. Can be either “sender” for a private chat with the inline query sender, “private”, “group”, “supergroup”, or “channel”. The chat type should be always known for requests sent from official clients and most third-party clients, unless the request was sent from a secret chat

fields.name: location
fields.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that request user location

types.name: InlineQueryResultsButton
types.description: This object represents a button to be shown above inline query results. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Label text on the button

fields.name: web_app
fields.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to switch back to the inline mode using the method switchInlineQuery inside the Web App.

fields.name: start_parameter
fields.description:
Optional. Deep-linking parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when a user presses the button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed.

Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an OAuth link. Once done, the bot can offer a switch_inline button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.
